intro: Elatostema tungyanshanense, commonly known as the Tungyanshan steller's mouse-ear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Tungyanshan region of Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. Elatostema tungyanshanense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
